titlestmt.subtitle: A Finding Aid to the Collection in the Library of Congress
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Jack Crawford, Wesley T. Brandhorst, and Fred Hershey

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division, 2014

did.head: Collection Summary
did.langmaterial: Collection material in German with some English and French
did.abstract: German author on aeronautical subjects, pioneer in aviation, and the first European to support the experiments of the Wright Brothers, full name: Alfred Louis Heinrich Hildebrandt. Correspondence, notes, diaries, clippings, scrapbooks, pamphlets, periodicals, books, maps and charts, pictures and photographs, and other material collected by Hildebrandt on the history and development of aviation, with the focus on Germany, including personal papers relating to his career as a pioneer and advocate of aeronautics.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers of A. Hildebrandt, German writer on aeronautical subjects, pioneer in aviation, and the first European to support the experiments of Wilbur and Orville Wright, were received in two collections. The first was purchased for the Aeronautics Division of the Library of Congress in 1932; the second was received as a gift in 1947. The collection was transferred to the Manuscript Division from the Aeronautics Division in 1954.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The papers of A. Hildebrandt were described in 1958. The finding aid was revised in 2014.

otherfindaid.head: Additional Guides
otherfindaid.p: The Hildebrandt Papers were described at the time of the second acquisition in the Library of Congress Quarterly Journal of Current Acquisitions 4, no. 4 (August 1947): 25-26; and mentioned in the Quarterly Journal of Current Acquisitions 12, no. 3 (May 1955): 121.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: It is the researcher's responsibility to determine requirements of domestic copyright laws and international treaties and conventions.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of A. Hildebrandt are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, A. Hildebrandt Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

eventgrp.event: Educated: Kriegschule; Universität (Naturwissenschaftliche Fakultät); Technische Hochschule; Bergakademie; received doctor of philosophy degree
Teacher of aviation in Officer's Institute
Member, editorial board of Moedebeck's Illustrierte Aeronautische Mitteilungen

chronitem.event: Edited Die Königlich preussische Luftschiffer Abteilung Berlin

eventgrp.event: Member, Kriege International Kommission für wissenschaftlicne Luftschiffahrt
President, International Kommission zur Herstellung von aeronitischen Landkarten
Published Die Luftschiffahrt nach ihrer geschichtlichen und gegenwärtigen Entwicklung (tanslated into English and Spanish)
Published Die Brüder Wright; enine Studie über die Entwicklung der Flugmaschine von Lilienthal bis Wright
Published Vergleich der Temperatur suf dem Brocken und in der gleichen Höhe der freien Atmosphäre auf grundneuerer Ballon-und Drachenaufstiege

chronitem.event: Edited Die Arbeiten der "Rostocker Luftware" in Friedrichshöle bei Rostock im Jahre 1913
Dropped from membership in National Socialist Party

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The papers of Alfred Louis Heinrich Hildebrandt (1870-1949) extend from 1826 to 1943, with the bulk of the material concentrated in the period 1910-1930. A pioneer in aviation, Hildebrandt was a German author on aeronautical subjects and the first European to support the experiments of the Wright Brothers. His collection focuses on the history of aviation in Germany from the time of balloon experiments to the development of airplanes in World War II. Included is material on aviation sports, inventions, laws, meteorology, aviation societies, transportation, and other activities, both national and international, in addition to personal papers on his career and aeronautics. The papers consist of correspondence, notes, diaries, clippings, scrapbooks, pamphlets, periodicals, books, maps and charts, pictures and photographs, and indexes.
Correspondents include Albert, Prince of Schleswig-Holstein-Glücksburg, Patrick Young Alexander, Octave Chanute, Ernst A. Damm, Hans Grade, Hans Ravenstein, and Graf Ferdinand von Zeppelin.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged alphabetically by subject or type of material.
